project.desc1: Misercook.com is a modern, responsive culinary platform designed with the convenience of users on various devices in mind. The site was built using technologies such as Angular, HTML5, CSS3, and TypeScript, ensuring smooth operation on both computers and mobile devices. Thanks to the use of responsive design based on media queries, the layout of the site automatically adapts to the screen resolution, providing optimal navigation and readability on phones, tablets, and laptops.
project.desc2: The homepage of Misercook.com is clear and intuitive, with distinct sections. Users can quickly browse recently added recipes, explore their favorites, and check out the recipe of the day, which is highlighted daily.
project.desc3: The Recipe Detail view displays all the details of the selected recipe, including a photo of the dish, detailed instructions, and an ingredient list that can be easily added to a shopping list.
project.desc4: Recipes have been divided into various categories to facilitate user searching and browsing. This allows users to quickly find interesting dishes in categories such as appetizers, meals for kids, desserts, or soups.
project.desc5: After logging into the website, there is an ability to add new recipes, create custom categories, and share cooking tips.
project.desc6: The shopping list is designed in a way that allows users to add products manually, but there is also an option to directly add all ingredients from a recipe.
project.desc7: Logging into the portal provides access to many additional features, such as editing, deleting, or adding recipes, categories, and cooking tips

about.text:
I'm 36 years old and have been living in Germany for over 10 years. My previous professional path led me to research food for children, medical food, and dietary supplements in a laboratory. After 10 years in this field, I made the decision to change my career direction.

Inspired by the encouragement of my husband, who is a programmer, I decided to try my hand in this field as well. I started completely from scratch, learning HTML, CSS, and Angular. I wanted to combine this new knowledge with another passion of mineâ€”cooking (and eating). As a result, I have created my own recipe platform - misercook.com. For me, this is not just a new career path but also a way to share my love of cooking with others around the world.
